name: Hardest USA Sports Potpourri Trivia Quiz | USA | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who won the Rose Bowl in February 2006?
questions.explanation:
USC.

	The University of Southern California, a Pac-10 team, defeated Illinois of the Big Ten 49-17 in the Rose Bowl.

questions.text: In 2008, which NFL quarterback for the Patriots suffered a season-ending injury?
questions.explanation:
Tom Brady.

	Tom Brady of the Patriots injured his knee in Week 1.  He never returned, but Matt Cassell shined in the spotlight.

questions.text: Who was the first player in NHL history to score at least 50 goals in a season in six consecutive seasons?
questions.explanation:
Guy Lafleur.

	From the 1974-75 season until 1979-80 season, Lafleur scored at least 50 times in a season for the Montreal Canadiens.

questions.text: In 2008, which small town in Illinois was home to the MLS Chicago Fire's Toyota Park?
questions.explanation:
Bridgeview.

	This small town of 15,335 people plays host to a soccer stadium with a capacity of 20,000.

questions.text: In the 1960s, Boxing great Cassius Clay officially changed his name to what?
questions.explanation:
Cassius X.

	Clay was good friends with Malcom X in the early 1960s.  He changed his name to Cassius X, but for only a short time before changing it again Muhammad Ali.

questions.text: In the 2008 season, which NFL quarterback said, "I didn't know that a tie was even in the rulebook"?
questions.explanation:
Donovan McNabb.

	The quarterback of the Philadelphia Eagles said this after blowing a game.  McNabb was highly criticized for his ignorance.

questions.text: During the decade of the 1970s, what was the only year that the Nittany Lions failed to play in a postseason bowl game?
questions.explanation:
1970.

	Coming off of consecutive 11-0 seasons, both of which were capped by Orange Bowl victories, the Lions saw their 31-game unbeaten streak end at Colorado. Losses to Wisconsin and Syracuse followed, and Penn State finished the season with a record of 7-3. The 1976 team lost in the Gator Bowl to Notre Dame to cap a 7-5 season. In 1977, Penn State made a strong case for a number one ranking by sealing a 11-1 season with a Fiesta Bowl win over Arizona State. 1979 was a down year, but it did end victoriously as the Nits beat Tulane in the Liberty Bowl.

questions.text: Who was the starting quarterback for Texas Tech when they won the Cotton Bowl on January 2, 2009?
questions.explanation:
Graham Harrell.

	Graham Harrell was the starting quarterback for the Red Raiders for the 2008 season.

questions.text: Which of these "C" teams won the 2008 MLS Cup?
questions.explanation:
Columbus Crew.

	One of the founding members of MLS in 1996, the Crew captured their first MLS Cup victory in 2008 defeating Red Bull New York 3-1.

questions.text: Who was the first player in NHL history to score three short-handed goals in a single regular season game?
questions.explanation:
Theo Fleury.

	Fleury scored the short-handed hat-trick on March 9th, 1991 while a member of the Calgary Flames.
